items.title: The appealing simplicity of htmx
items.content:
#â€‹691 â€” June 6, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Promises from the Ground Up â€” Josh notes that in order to truly understand promises, a fundamental part of modern JS development, we need â€œa surprisingly deep understanding of how JavaScript works and what its limitations areâ€. Luckily, this tutorial covers all the critical context youÂ need.

Josh W Comeau

ğŸ’¡ If you're a bit more advanced, you might enjoy Alex MacArthur's look at controlling promises using Promise.withResolvers().

A Powerful JavaScript Reporting Tool Built for theÂ Web â€” ActiveReportsJS is the premier JavaScript reporting tool designed for advanced data visualizations in web applications. With many different advanced report builders and viewers, insights can be seamlessly shared with your entire userÂ base.

ActiveReportsJS from MESCIUS inc sponsor

htmx: Simplicity in an Age of Complicated Solutions â€” htmx provides access to numerous dynamic features, like Ajax requests and page updates, by way of HTML attributes, and has been increasing in popularity recently. Erik looks at why its simplicity is particularlyÂ appealing.

Erik Heemskerk

ğŸ“º YouTuber DevelopedByEd has a neat â–¶ï¸ 15 minute Go + htmx quickstart screencast targeting JavaScript developers keen to explore newÂ approaches.

IN BRIEF:

  • âš™ï¸ ESLint has unveiled a new ESLint configuration migrator to help bring your config files up toÂ speed.

  • Astro's Starlight documentation site framework has turned one year old â€“ v1.0 is due later thisÂ year.

  • The Val Town bite-size JavaScript deployment platform is really taking off. They've added a page of trending Vals to show off what people areÂ upÂ to.

  • WebAssemblyâ€™s JavaScript Promise Integration (JSPI) API has a new API in ChromeÂ 126+.

RELEASES:

  • Turborepo 2.0 â€“ The high-performance buildÂ system.

  • ESLint 9.4 â€“ Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

  • ğŸ¦– Docusaurus 3.4 â€“ The fantastic site / docs site framework.

  • Prettier 3.3, Biome 1.8, Ember.js 5.9, pnpm 9.2

Revolutionizing UI Development with Chromatic and StackBlitz â€” In our upcoming live stream, we'll be speaking with the Chromatic team about actionable strategies to improve your design systemÂ workflow.

StackBlitz sponsor

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Data Fetching Patterns in Single-Page Applications â€” With a level of depth youâ€™d expect from a Martin Fowler production, Atlassianâ€™s Juntao Qiu walks through five different patterns to consider when fetching remote data, using a realistic scenario to show themÂ off.

Juntao Qiu and Martin Fowler

A Brisk VS Code Extension Development Speedrun â€” Literally a brisk tutorial, but Brisk is also the name of a CI tool the extension in question is being developedÂ for.

Sean Reilly

Tracing: Frontend Issues with Backend Solutions â€” Join us live to learn how to identify the issues causing poor Core Web Vitals and trace them through yourÂ stack.

Sentry sponsor

Full Stack Web Push API Guide â€” A complete implementation of push notifications in a Remix app. â€œIf you follow the walk through to the end, youâ€™ll have working pushÂ notifications.â€

Boaz Sender

ğŸ“„ Node Leaking Memory? setTimeout Could be the Reason Armin Ronacher

ğŸ“„ Write Your First Chrome Extension: A Guide Lizzie Paris

ğŸ“„ Goodbye Netlify, Hello Cloudflare â€“ When the bandwidth charges start toÂ sting.. Harrison Broadbent

ğŸ“º Effortless Vue.js Forms CDRUC

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Motion Canvas: Create Dynamic Canvas-Rendered Animations â€” Thereâ€™s two parts. A library where you use generator functions to procedurally define animations, and an editor that provides a real-time preview of said animations which you can see in actionÂ here.

Motion Canvas

Merge Anything 6.0: Merge Objects and Other Types Recursively â€” If youâ€™re looking for something that goes a bit deeper than Object.assign(), say.

Luca Ban

TypeScriptToLua: Write Lua with TypeScript â€” Lua is embedded in all sorts of places (games, Redis, NGINX..) so being able to write JavaScript and have it converted could open up some extra opportunities forÂ you.

TypeScriptToLua Contributors

Breakpoints and console.log is the Past, Time Travel is the Future â€” 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and console.log, supports Vitest, jest, karma, jasmine, andÂ more.

Wallaby Team sponsor

Zigar: Write and Use Zig Code in Node and Electron Projects â€” Zig is a newish systems language thatâ€™s essentially a superset of C/C++. Zigar wants to make using C/C++/Zig code easier in JavaScriptÂ projects.

Chung Leong

  • Wouter 3.2 â€“ Minimalist router for React &Â Preact. You can now use regular expressions to define custom route patternsÂ too.

  • PKI.js 3.1 â€“ Pure JS library for working with public key oriented systems. Certificates, signing,Â etc.

  • Fontsource â€“ 1700+ open source fonts packaged as npmÂ packages.

  • tscircuit â€“ Design circuit boards using a React-basedÂ approach.

  • Prisma 5.15 â€“ Popular ORM for Node.js andÂ TypeScript.

  • melonJS 17.3 â€“ Lightweight HTML5 gameÂ engine.

ğŸ¤–Â A quick AI-side

First, a handy library:

KaTeX: The Fastest Math Typesetting Library for the Web â€” All these AI And machine learning papers and blog posts these days are crammed with mathematical notation, so how about a no dependency, TeX-based approach to rendering them? The sandbox demo page shows off how smooth itÂ is.

Emily Eisenberg and Sophie Alpert

Second, you may recall that last year (in issue 654) I mentioned a new AI engineering event being put on by two JavaScript developers called The AI Engineer Summit. It turned out to be fantastic and it's back later this month in a much larger form called The AI Engineer World's Fair (June 25-27 in SanÂ Francisco).

The speaker list is a veritable 'who's who' of the ML-leaning development scene with all the main LLM providers present too, so I've decided, at the last minute, I need to be there! If you're interested in going too, they've given us a link with 30% off all the ticket prices for you toÂ use.

items.title: A variety of JS hacks and creative coding
items.content:
#â€‹690 â€” May 30, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

How 1Password Used esbuild to Cut Browser Extension Build Times â€” 1Password is a popular password management tool that relies upon a browser extension to fill out passwords on the Web. At over a minute for a single build, things were starting to drag for the devs. Could esbuild help? A fun story with plenty of technicalÂ details.

Jarek Samic

Next.js 15 Release Candidate â€” The popular React meta framework gets ready for a major new release with a RC giving you an opportunity to experiment with React 19 (and React Compiler) support, executing code after a response with next/after, and a few potentially breakingÂ changes.

Delba de Oliveira and Zack Tanner

Everything You Need to Know About Git â€” Join ThePrimeagen for this extensive video course and ensure you never run into an unsolvable Git problem again. You'll learn advanced git abilities like interactive rebasing, bisecting, worktrees, the reflog, andÂ more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

aem1k: A Variety of JS Hacks and Creative Coding â€” This is a fun one. Martin really captures the joy and expressiveness of JavaScript and the Web with his collection of projects, whether itâ€™s offering a NSFW-named tool to convert your JavaScript into just six characters, rendering a spinning globe in 1KB of JS, the Game of Life in 176 bytes, and many more suchÂ experiments.

Martin Kleppe

IN BRIEF:

  • The folks behind the long standing Gulp build tool are running a survey to help make Gulp better and suit modern needs. It closes tomorrow.

  • ğŸ«  JavaScript's creator Brendan Eich popped up on Twitter/X to refute a claim that JS is "the most slop" by saying it's only 50% so.. I don't get itÂ either.

  • If you haven't gone down the JSR rabbit hole yet, let â–¶ï¸ Ryan Dahl convince you through his DevWorld 2024 talk. (29Â minutes.)

  • Three.js introduces its own 'TSL' shader language as a way to write WebGPU shaders with JavaScript rather than the WebGPU ShadingÂ Language.

RELEASES:

  • Astro 4.9 â€“ The framework that does everything now does even more, gaining React 19 enhancements, plus a Container API for rendering Astro components outside of AstroÂ apps.

  • Node.js v18.20.3 (LTS) and v20.14.0 (LTS).

  • Rspack 0.7 â€“ Fast Rust-based webÂ bundler.

  • Storybook 8.1 â€“ The frontend component workshop.

  • Deno 1.44

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

10 Modern Node.js Runtime Features to Start Using in 2024 â€” If it ever feels like the new feature spotlight shines too much on Bun or Deno, never fear - Node.js has been taking huge strides forward too. Liran looks at lots of whatâ€™sÂ new.

Liran Tal

ECMAScript 2023 Feature: Symbols as WeakMap keys â€” Dr. Axel continues his look at language features by explaining what WeakMaps are for and why using symbols for keys has addedÂ benefits.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Introducing a New Fullstack TypeScript DX from AWS â€” Build every part of your appâ€™s cloud backend with TypeScript: auth? TypeScript. Data? TypeScript. Storage?Â TypeScript.

AWS Amplify sponsor

â–¶Â Â uBlock Origin: Let's Read the Code â€” A prolific code reader spends some time digging into the popular ad blocker thatâ€™s almost entirely built inÂ JavaScript.

Ants Are Everywhere

Why We Need a Standard JavaScript ORM for SQL Databases â€” ..and is it Drizzle?

Paul Scanlon (The New Stack)

Want Out of React Complexity? Try Vue â€” A high level piece that may provide some context if you havenâ€™t dabbled with VueÂ yet.

Richard MacManus (The New Stack)

Stale Thinking Causes Teams to Thrash â€” You Need a Breath of FreshÂ AirÂ â˜€ï¸ â€” Get fresh perspective from product managers whoâ€™ve been-there-done-that across tons of domains, use cases, andÂ problems.

Test Double sponsor

ğŸ“„ Why We Don't Have a Laravel For JavaScript... Yet Vince Canger (Wasp)

ğŸ“„ Itâ€™s Not Just You, Next.js is Getting Harder to Use Andrew Israel

ğŸ“„ How to Create a Modal in React with HTML's <dialog> Colby Fayock

ğŸ“„ What's New in Angular 18 Gergely Szerovay

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Regexper: Display JavaScript Regular Expressions as RailroadÂ Diagrams â€” Might come in handy for learning regular expressions or if you have a complex regular expression and you donâ€™t know what it does (not an uncommonÂ situation..!)

Jeff Avallone

Hono 4.4: The Standards-Based JS Web App Framework for Everywhere â€” Hono is a small, fast web framework with a straightforward API, middleware support, and that runs pretty much on anything (Deno, Bun, Node, Cloudflare, and more). v4.4 brings it to JSR, adds timeout middleware, and a helper to get information about connectedÂ clients.

Yusuke Wada and Contributors

Your Fastest Path to Production â€” Build, deploy, and scale your apps with unparalleled ease â€“ from your first user to yourÂ billionth.

Render sponsor

Inertia.js 1.1: Build SPAs for Any Backend â€” Inertia acts as â€˜glueâ€™ between various frontend libraries (React, Vue, or Svelte, say) and server-side frameworks (e.g. Rails orÂ Laravel).

Jonathan Reinink

ShareDB 5.0: Realtime Database Backend Based on Operational Transformation â€” For when you need real time synchronization of JSON documents (such as for behind a real time collaborationÂ app).

ShareJS

  • PyMiniRacer v0.12.2 â€“ Call your Python from your JavaScript from yourÂ Python.

  • Knip 5.17.0 â€“ Finds and removes unused files, dependencies and exports. Now withÂ more.

  • PM2 5.4 â€“ Popular Node.js-based process manager forÂ production.

  • Melange 4.0 â€“ OCaml compiler for JavaScriptÂ developers.

  • Neutralinojs 5.2 â€“ Lightweight cross-platform desktop appÂ framework.

  • Billboard.js 3.12 â€“ The popular chart library gets funnelÂ charts.

  • Peaks.js 3.4 â€“ BBC-created audio waveform UIÂ component.

  • Happy DOM 14.12 â€“ JS implementation of a web browser sansÂ UI.

  • Retire.js 5.0 â€“ Scans for JS libraries with knownÂ vulnerabilities.

  • React Native Boilerplate 4.2 â€“ A starter template for RNÂ apps.

  • RE:DOM 4.1 â€“ Tiny library for creating user interfaces.

  • AlaSQL.js 4.4 â€“ Isomorphic JavaScript SQLÂ database.

  • is-what 5.0 â€“ Simple, small JS type checkÂ functions.

  • FxTS 1.0 â€“ Functional programmingÂ library.

â°Â And one for fun..

Qlock: A JavaScript Quine Clock â€” We linked to Martin's array of creative JavaScript experiments earlier, but why not finish with one that particularly tickled us? A quine is a program that takes no input but manages to produce, as output, its own source code. Hereâ€™s a fun JavaScript example that isnâ€™t merely a quine, but a clockÂ too.

Martin Kleppe

items.title: SolidJS is off to a solid start
items.content:
#â€‹689 â€” May 23, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Creating Realistic Handwriting with p5.js â€” Amy wanted to programatically bring her (cursive) handwriting into some diagrams she was making and figured out how to make it happen with p5.js. Here'sÂ how.

Amy Goodchild

SolidStart 1.0: The Shape of Frameworks to Come? â€” SolidJS is a React-inspired declarative UI library but with a performance focus and templates compiled to real DOM nodes receiving direct DOM updates â€“ no VDOM. SolidStart is a framework for building and deploying SolidJS apps with many compelling features right out of theÂ box.

SolidJS Core Team

WorkOS: Enterprise-Grade Auth You Can Implement in Minutes â€” Like an enterprise plan in a box: WorkOS provides flexible, easy-to-use APIs to integrate SSO, SCIM, Audit Logs, User Management, and more. Used by some of the hottest startups including Perplexity, Vercel, & Webflow. Future-proof your auth stack withÂ WorkOS.

WorkOS sponsor

Angular v18 Released â€” The large-scale framework got a big public revival last year with Angular 17 and its new homepage. Things continue to progress with experimental support for zoneless change detection and the new built-in control flow approach becomingÂ stable.

Minko Gechev

IN BRIEF:

  • Ever considered trying the Go language? One JavaScript developer did and shared their first impressions.

  • Remix's Ryan Florence has posted an update to clear up any confusion around the so-called 'merging' of React Router andÂ Remix.

  • Vercel has raised $250m in a Series E round, valuing it at $3.25bn.

  • The maintainer of the Node LDAP library has decommissioned it after vile abuse. If you're having trouble with an open source project, beÂ nice.

  • ğŸ—³ï¸ The 2024 Stack Overflow Developer Survey is now live until JuneÂ 7.

RELEASES:

  • Next.js 15 Release Candidate

  • ESLint v9.3.0

  • Node.js v18.20.3 (LTS)

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

City in a Bottle: Raycasting in 256 Bytes â€” Frank has a great reputation for putting together stunning visual demos with the tiniest amounts of JavaScript. This is no exception. He goes into a lot of detail about how it works; youâ€™ll learn a few things and/or come awayÂ awe-struck.

Frank Force

ğŸŒ† His dissection of a similar visual demo a few years ago is fantasticÂ too.

5 Easy Tips to Improve Your Personal Website Performance â€” Salma Alam-Naylor shares easy ways to give your personal website (and all other websites, in fact) a performanceÂ boost.

Sentry sponsor

â–¶Â Â The React Compiler: Going In-Depth â€” Last week we mentioned the open sourcing of the new React Compiler, but if you want to see it in action, this is for you. Jack's excitement isÂ palpable.

Jack Herrington

ğŸ’¡ Ricky Hanlon of the React team has put together a fantastic recap of last week's React Conf 2024 if you want to get up toÂ speed.

Chrome DevTools Offers AI for Understanding Errors and Warnings â€” Not everyone is going to like this, but itâ€™s optional. Also: the first Chrome feature that requires you be overÂ 18?

Guo, Emelianova, and Yeen (Google)

ğŸ“ŠÂ A Guide to JS Performance Analysis with Chrome DevTools â€” If your prefer your debugging experience AI-free, rest easy. This is a thorough walkthrough of the practicalities of using the Chrome DevTools for digging into performanceÂ issues.

Jiayi Hu

Software Consultants Your Team Actually Wants to Work with ğŸ¥³ â€” Test Double solves tough problems from strategy to execution. Weekly rates. Open contracts. No managementÂ required.

Test Double sponsor

ğŸ“„ Creating a Virtual DOM in 200 Lines of JavaScript â€“ A way to understand the basics behind theÂ concept. Marcelo Lazaroni

ğŸ“„ ECMAScript Proposal: Duplicate Named Capturing Groups for Regular Expressions Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

ğŸ“„ Digging Into an Arbitrary JS Execution Vulnerability in PDF.js Codean Labs

ğŸ“„ The Dilemmas You'll Face When Creating a Component Library Andrico Karoulla

ğŸ“„ Branded Types for TypeScript Carlos Menezes

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

ğŸ–‹ï¸Â Signature Pad 5.0: Smooth Signature Drawing Control â€” If you need people to give you their John Hancock on the web, use this to let them make their unintelligible, but legally binding, scribbles. GitHubÂ repo.

Szymon Nowak

VitePress 1.2: Vite & Vue Powered Static Site Generator â€” From the creator of both Vue.js and Vite, a Markdown-oriented static site generator with a particularly smooth developerÂ experience.

Evan You

Ditch Passwords for Good: Embrace the Future of Secure Login withÂ Passkeys â€” Ditch passwords for passkeys, the secure biometric login solution eliminating password pain while fortifying userÂ accounts.

FusionAuth sponsor

Jira.js 4.0: A Wrapper for Atlassian Jira's Cloud APIs â€” Love Jira? Become even happier by interacting with it with code. Docs andÂ examples.

Vladislav Tupikin

  • Brainchop 4.0 (above) â€“ An in-browser 3D MRI rendering system. (Demo.)

  • Redwood 7.6 â€“ GraphQL-driven ReactÂ framework. Now with experimental React CompilerÂ support.

  • Axios 1.7 â€“ Long-standing, promise-based isomorphic HTTPÂ client.

  • Safe Units 2.0 â€“ Type-safe library for using units ofÂ measurement.

  • ğŸ–‹ï¸ Atrament 4.4 â€“ Library for smooth drawing on HTMLÂ canvases.

  • â™Ÿï¸ React Chessboard 4.6 â€“ Render chess boards withÂ React. (Demo.)

  • ka-table 10.0 â€“ Lightweight React table component.Â (Demos.)

  • jQuery Terminal Emulator 2.42 â€“ For web-based terminalÂ experiences.Â (Demo.)

  • Abracadabra 9.2 â€“ Automated JS and TS refactorings for VSÂ Code.
items.contentSnippet:
#â€‹689 â€” May 23, 2024


Read on the Web




    
    

JavaScript Weekly




  





  
  
Creating Realistic Handwriting with p5.js â€” Amy wanted to programatically bring her (cursive) handwriting into some diagrams she was making and figured out how to make it happen with p5.js. Here'sÂ how.
Amy Goodchild 


  
  
SolidStart 1.0: The Shape of Frameworks to Come? â€” SolidJS is a React-inspired declarative UI library but with a performance focus and templates compiled to real DOM nodes receiving direct DOM updates â€“ no VDOM. SolidStart is a framework for building and deploying SolidJS apps with many compelling features right out of theÂ box.
SolidJS Core Team 


  
  
WorkOS: Enterprise-Grade Auth You Can Implement in Minutes â€” Like an enterprise plan in a box: WorkOS provides flexible, easy-to-use APIs to integrate SSO, SCIM, Audit Logs, User Management, and more. Used by some of the hottest startups including Perplexity, Vercel, & Webflow. Future-proof your auth stack withÂ WorkOS.
WorkOS sponsor


  
  
Angular v18 Released â€” The large-scale framework got a big public revival last year with Angular 17 and its new homepage. Things continue to progress with experimental support for zoneless change detection and the new built-in control flow approach becomingÂ stable.
Minko Gechev 


IN BRIEF:
Ever considered trying the Go language? One JavaScript developer did and shared their first impressions.
Remix's Ryan Florence has posted an update to clear up any confusion around the so-called 'merging' of React Router andÂ Remix.
Vercel has raised $250m in a Series E round, valuing it at $3.25bn.
The maintainer of the Node LDAP library has decommissioned it after vile abuse. If you're having trouble with an open source project, beÂ nice.
ğŸ—³ï¸ The 2024 Stack Overflow Developer Survey is now live until JuneÂ 7.


RELEASES:
Next.js 15 Release Candidate
ESLint v9.3.0
Node.js v18.20.3 (LTS)

City in a Bottle: Raycasting in 256 Bytes â€” Frank has a great reputation for putting together stunning visual demos with the tiniest amounts of JavaScript. This is no exception. He goes into a lot of detail about how it works; youâ€™ll learn a few things and/or come awayÂ awe-struck.
Frank Force

items.title: Remix + React Router == React Router?
items.content:
#â€‹688 â€” May 16, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

ğŸ“„ Â How to Document Your JavaScript Package â€” Youâ€™ve written some useful code, you want to distribute it.. what next? Useful docs! The Deno team demonstrates the value of JSDoc and writing documentation alongside your usual sourceÂ code.

The Deno Team

Digging Into the Promise.withResolvers() Proposal â€” Itâ€™s so good to see Dr. Axel blogging again after a year away. He digs into the proposed Promise.withResolvers feature (now at stage 4) and why you might prefer to use it to create promises in a moreÂ elegantÂ way.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

WorkOS: Enterprise-Grade Auth You Can Implement inÂ Minutes â€” Like an enterprise plan in a box: WorkOS provides flexible, easy-to-use APIs to integrate SSO, SCIM, Audit Logs, User Management, and more. Used by some of the hottest startups including Perplexity, Vercel, & Webflow. Future-proof your auth stack withÂ WorkOS.

WorkOS sponsor

Now You Can Try the React Compiler â€” A big item at this weekâ€™s React Conf was the open sourcing of Reactâ€™s experimental compiler to optimize React code at build time. Theyâ€™ve also created a React Compiler Playground to experimentÂ with.

The React Team

IN BRIEF:

  • At Google I/O, the Google team unveiled the Web Platform Dashboard (above), a way to see the web platform mapped as a set of features, along with their cross browserÂ support.

  • â­ Remix and React Router have a shared history (and, increasingly, features) and that's culminating in the merging of Remix and React Router: "What we planned to release as Remix v3 is now going to be released as React RouterÂ v7."

  • The Deno Standard Library is now available on JSR.

RELEASES:

  • zx 8.1 â€“ Google's tool for better Node shellÂ scripting. Both CommonJS and ESM now supported, increased Node version support, and Deno 1.xÂ support.

  • Node.js 22.2 (Current), Storybook 8.1, Astro 4.8, Bun 1.1.8

  • ReacType v21 â€“ Visual prototyping tool for ReactÂ apps.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Make Your GitHub Profile Dynamic with Bun and TypeScript â€” GitHub offers the ability to upload a profile README file thatâ€™s rendered at the top of your user page. If you want to have it dynamically update with links to your latest blog posts, statistics, or other bits of info, you can do it with a little JavaScript and GitHubÂ Actions.

Duy Ng

Your Fastest Path to Production â€” Build, deploy, and scale your apps with unparalleled ease â€“ from your first user to yourÂ billionth.

Render sponsor

â–¶Â Â Learn with Me: Hono â€” Iâ€™m biased, since I think Takuyaâ€™s videos are amazing and am a huge fan of his note taking app, Inkdrop, but itâ€™s neat to see someone sink their teeth into trying the Hono JS appÂ framework.

Takuya Matsuyama

ğŸ“„ Build Your Own React.js in 400 Lines of Code â€“ A learningÂ exercise. Zachary Lee

ğŸ“„ The Carcinization of Web Frameworks â€“ Are frameworks all starting to lookÂ alike? Jacob Kofoed

ğŸ“„ Five Basic Things About JavaScript to Help Non JavaScript-Focused WebÂ Designers Chris Coyier

ğŸ“„ Personal-Scale Web Scraping for Fun and Profit Sean Morrissey

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

ğŸ•¹ï¸Â Athena Crisis: A Quality, JS-Powered Game â€” A commercial, turn-based strategy game available on the Steam Store, but now with an open sourced engine and tooling. The game is published by Null, an indie game publisher founded by GitHub cofounder ChrisÂ Wanstrath.

Christoph Nakazawa

fuzzysort 3.0: Fast Fuzzy Search Library â€” Check out the live example â€“ it certainly feelsÂ quick.

Stephen Kamenar

Make the Scary Things Boring ğŸ˜… â€” Been told to do more with less? Talk to Test Double about how to deliver with fewer people without losingÂ quality.

Test Double sponsor

GraphQL Yoga: A Full-Featured GraphQL Server â€” Create a schema, spin up a server, and youâ€™re good to go (then you get to wire everything up). Supports GraphQL subscriptions via SSE. Designed to run across environments from Node to AWS Lambda, Deno, Bun, etc. GitHubÂ repo.

The Guild

Vue Fluid DnD: An Animated Drag-and-Drop Library for Vue â€” Designed for lists of items and you can view a variety of examples here, including one where the items are draggable using handles. GitHubÂ repo.

Carlos Jorge Rodriguez

Transformational Auth & Identity | Userfront â€” "Compared to our previous experiences in the security/auth space, Userfront is an order of magnitude simpler toÂ use."

Userfront sponsor

ğŸ—¾Â React Google Maps 1.0: Components and Hooks for Google Maps â€” Provides a way to integrate Googleâ€™s Maps API into a React app, with components to lay down markers, draw over maps, etc. GitHubÂ repo.

OpenJS Foundation

  • alphaTab 1.3 (above) â€“ Music notation and guitar tablature rendering library. It's able to play the music, too, although the vibrato on the guitar sounded rather odd on my machine..Â ğŸ˜…

  • React Awesome Query Builder 6.5 â€“ Logical query builder control. (Demo.)

  • ğŸ¨ jquery-color 3.0 â€“ jQuery plugin for color manipulation andÂ transitions.

  • Jdenticon 3.3 â€“ Library for generating geometricÂ 'identicons'.

  • OverlayScrollbars 2.8 â€“ JS custom scrollbarÂ plugin.

  • NodeBB 3.8 â€“ Node.js based forumÂ system.

ğŸÂ And one for fun..

Code Screenshot: A VS Code Extension to Create Code Screenshots â€” It basically loads your code into this site (which you can use directly, if you'd rather not install an extension) where you can tweak settings/theme and export to either a PNG orÂ SVG.

Vkrsi / Visual Studio Marketplace

ğŸ’¡ Carbon remains a great option for this task, too.

title: JavaScript Weekly
description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects
